This led to the Oyo State Government to request technical and financial support from the World Bank Group to build back better the damaged infrastructure and to enhance the city's resilience to flooding.\n\n## Funding and Scale\n\nThis brought about the inception of the Ibadan Urban Flood Management Project (IUFMP) a $200 million project from the International Development Association (IDA). One of the key components of the project was to finance a series of strategic studies, namely i) the city masterplan, ii) a solid waste management masterplan, and iii) a flood risk management and drainage masterplan.\n\n## Dar Al-Handasah's Role\n\nThe project comprised offering planning and urban design services to create a strategic master plan for Ibadan and its hinterland, covering the period up to 2035. It also includes three Detailed Urban Plans covering the core, the flood prone areas, and Ibadan Circular Road.\n\n## Stakeholder Engagement\n\nDar led the delivery of a multi-sectoral stakeholder engagement process that gathered hundreds of comments from all facets of society – from top to grassroots levels.
